intro: Myosotis sylvatica var. montana, commonly known as the mountain forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower displays.
